capybarasFacts.title: Food for thought 💩
capybarasFacts.description: Much like rabbits, capybaras eat their own dung to extract maximum nutrition from their food!

capybarasFacts.title: No mean feet 🦅
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras have webbed feet that help them maneuver in water and escape predators like anacondas, wild cats and even eagles!

capybarasFacts.title: Freediving 🤿
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras can dive and stay underwater for up to 5 minutes!

capybarasFacts.title: Place your bets 🐎
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras can run on land at speeds up to 35 kilometers an hour - that's as fast as a horse!

capybarasFacts.title: Quiet, please! 🤫
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras have an extensive vocabulary, often expressing themselves through purring, barking, cackling, whistling, squealing, whining, grunting and even teeth-chattering!

capybarasFacts.title: Pearly whites 🦷
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras teeth never stop growing in order to keep up with the constant wear and tear from their diet!

capybarasFacts.title: Nature's ottoman 🦦
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras are easy-going critters - birds, rabbits, monkeys and even other capybaras have been spotted seated, perched or laying on the back of a much-obliging capybara!

capybarasFacts.title: I scratch your back... 💇
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras are incredibly social and display symbiotic relationships with other animals, offering a buffet of resident insects whilst enjoying their free grooming session in return!

capybarasFacts.title: Heavy hitter 😲
capybarasFacts.description: Capybaras are heavier than they seem, weighing anywhere between 35 and 70 kilograms - that's as much as a human!
